brand.name: LIS - Legume Information System
brand.slogan: Information about legume traits for crop improvement

search.caption: A Search view using a genomic context from Phaseolus vulgaris (common bean) Chromosome II as the query. Note, the result genomic context from Glycine max (soybean) Chromosome I contains an inversion. Also, the Global dot plot of Arachis hypogaea (peanut) reveals an inversion not present in the Micro-Synteny viewer. Lastly, the Macro-Synteny viewer reveals that some of the result genomic contexts belong to larger syntenic structures.

multi.caption: A Multi view for genomic contexts derived from the same gene family representing 11 chromosomes from 9 different species, as illustrated by the Macro-Synteny Circos-style viewer. Note, the genomic context from Glycine max (soybean) Chromosome I contains an inversion. Also, the highlighted portion of each chromosome's arc in the Macro-Synteny viewer reveals that many of the genomic contexts belong to larger syntenic structures.

examples: Common bean gene phavu.Phvul.002G085200 highly conserved across syntenic contexts among legumes (with inversion in soybean)
